title: (x) Insights on the Lotus Sutra - Friz Quadrata {Stephen}
content:
This is so obvious, but I can't remember the name of this font no matter how hard I try and I need it now! Help

Font for Lotus Sutra
type.tif (171.5 k)
author: hera

comments.content: Thank you! It's from the front of a book cover that I need to reproduce. The type I scanned was very close together so some of the letters may have come out funny, but Friz Quadrata it is, and I thank you!

It's possible that the sample was squeezed just enough to make it look more monoline than it actually is, though I wouldn't bet money on that theory.   
   
Nice new icon, Stewf. Man, everyone's getting cool icons now. I'm gonna have to work on mine.

Hey,   
I have bought a whole collection of those matchbox stickers (+300pcs) last summer in Czech republic! A guy on street sold it for almost nothing. I wonder if it was his OWN collection...

Although your version has a geometric, monoline ['O'](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003628/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/friz-quadrata/friz-quadrata/character/004F/CP4/). Hmm...   
Maybe it just lost some of the stroke contrast in the scan.   
Where is the sample from, Melanie?
Thanks Chesh. I swiped it from a collection of lovely [Czech matchbooks](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003628/http:/www.cardhouse.com/a/distress/distress.htm).
